title: 19 non-resolved S0 critical items and 383 open S1 items in TDMS backlog
description: MASTER_DEBT.jsonl contains 40 S0 items of which only 19 are resolved and 2 are false positives — leaving 19 open S0 critical items (15 VERIFIED + 4 NEW). Additionally, 383 S1 items remain in VERIFIED status. Key open S0 items include: App Check disabled in production (DEBT-0853), CI security vulnerability with pull_request_target (DEBT-1878), 57 AI Instructions sections adding ~4,500 unnecessary lines (DEBT-2381), and multiple cognitive complexity violations in admin.ts and component files.
recommendation: Prioritize S0 triage: resolve or re-classify the 19 open S0 items. Schedule a sprint to address the top 10 S1 items by impact.
evidence:
Total TDMS items: 2672
S0 breakdown: 40 total — 19 RESOLVED, 2 FALSE_POSITIVE, 15 VERIFIED, 4 NEW
S1 breakdown: 439 total — 383 VERIFIED (open)
Resolution rate: 11% overall
Open critical items include DEBT-0853 (App Check disabled), DEBT-1878 (CI security), DEBT-2381 (AI Instructions bloat)
suggested_fix: Run /alerts to get prioritized view of open S0/S1 items. Create a focused sprint to resolve top-priority S0 items. Items that are no longer relevant should be reclassified as FALSE_POSITIVE with justification.
suggestion_text: Accept at S2. The 19 open S0 items represent known critical issues from prior audits. While tracked, their continued open status indicates a resolution velocity problem.
counter_argument: All S0 items are tracked in TDMS and visible via /alerts. The 11% resolution rate reflects that most items were recently imported from audit aggregation. Resolution velocity will improve as the project matures.

title: Multi-AI audit (maa-2026-02-17) incomplete — 65 unified findings never triaged
description: The multi-AI audit session maa-2026-02-17-182d43 generated 65 unified findings in final/UNIFIED-FINDINGS.jsonl but the workflow never progressed past the 'starting' phase. All 9 category audits remain in PENDING status. The 65 findings have not been triaged, reviewed, or synced to MASTER_DEBT.jsonl, meaning potential consensus findings from multiple AI reviewers are sitting unprocessed.
recommendation: Either complete the multi-AI audit workflow (triage the 65 findings) or mark the session as abandoned and sync high-confidence findings manually.
evidence:
Session status: IN_PROGRESS, phase: starting
All 9 categories: PENDING (0 findings processed)
65 unified findings generated but untriaged
Last updated: 2026-02-17T20:33:13.075Z (2 days ago, no progress)
suggested_fix: Run /multi-ai-audit --resume to continue the workflow, or manually review final/UNIFIED-FINDINGS.jsonl and sync high-value findings to MASTER_DEBT.jsonl.
suggestion_text: Accept at S3. The untriaged findings are a data hygiene issue — they may duplicate existing TDMS items or contain unique insights.
counter_argument: The multi-AI audit findings likely overlap significantly with single-session audit findings already in TDMS. The effort to triage 65 findings may not yield many net-new actionable items.
